title: Epithelial-Myoepithelial Carcinoma of the Breast with Rhabdoid Features
patient: A 76-year-old woman presented with the right breast painful mass at an outside institution. On mammography, the mass measured 3.0 to 4.0 cm and had an ill-defined border (). No calcifications were noted. An ultrasound examination revealed a heterogeneous mass with cystic component measuring 3.2 cm, without axillary adenopathy. Patient underwent fine needle aspiration and core needle biopsy, which were suspicious for malignancy but inconclusive for definite diagnosis. Patient underwent total mastectomy with sentinel lymph node biopsy.
